title: U.S. House Republicans Push for Crypto Oversight With Bill to Make SEC Play Ball
description: Crypto exchanges would gain a path to registering with the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) and would be able to trade digital securities, commodities and stablecoins all in one place under a proposal from the Republican chairs of the two House of Representatives committees trying to hash out a bill.

title: CFTC proposes rule change to strengthen risk management for digital assets
description: The United States Commodity Futures Trading Commission (CFTC) has proposed to amend its risk management program in response to the growing influence of digital assets and emerging technologies. Commissioner Christy Goldsmith Romero emphasized the need to address the risks associated with cryptocurrencies and artificial intelligence while highlighting concerns regarding industry custody practices. The proposal, aimed ... Read more

title: SHIB Competitor Floki Announces Game-Changing Partnership with Binance Pay to Serve Billions of Users Worldwide
description:
FLOKI announces a  partnership with Binance Pay the cryptocurrency payment service offered by Binance. FLOKI witnessed a substantial surge, exceeding $60 million, representing a remarkable rise. Floki Inu, the web3 initiative responsible for the well-known meme token FLOKI, has revealed a  partnership with Binance Pay, the cryptocurrency payment service offered by Binance, the biggest cryptocurrency [...]

title: Bitcoin (BTC) Hovers Below $27,000 as US Jobs Numbers Soar, Beating Many Estimates
description:
Bitcoin (BTC) continues to trade sideways around the $27,000 mark as new data reveals better-than-expected US job numbers. According to an economic news release by the U.S. Bureau of Labor Statistics (BLS), payroll employment rose by 339,000 in May despite the unemployment rate increasing by 0.3% to 3.7%. “Total nonfarm payroll employment increased by 339,000 […]

The post Bitcoin (BTC) Hovers Below $27,000 as US Jobs Numbers Soar, Beating Many Estimates appeared first on The Daily Hodl.
